Reviews.Title: “Clean good value and extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: My stay was excellent; the room was quiet and clean and very good value. I left some items behind in the room and the hotel staff subsequently located them and posted them to me at home in London. I was delighted with this excellent and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephan R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a uni-class reunion and the hotel was very conveniently placed - close to Saint Denis Metro.. The service was excellent and all staff I encountered were very courteous and helpful. The (twin) room was very comfortable – not very spacey but all amenities were available; even the (free) wifi worked! The bathroom consisted of a large open shower, separate toilet and wash basin. All was in excellent condition, operating and clean. The breakfast is in the cellar – watch your head on the way down, a nice experience. It was not really clear though what the quick breakfast was which would cost 7 Euros… the buffet was very nice – I was charged the 12 Euros although I had no hot food. Merci beaucoup – for a nice stay. I will stay there again when visiting Paris coming from Scotland…

Reviews.Title: “Does the important things well; great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chumbeiro
Reviews.Content: Well placed for exploring central Paris: 5 minutes walk to Metro, 15 minutes Gare du Est, 25 Gare du Nord, 25 to River Seine . This is a relatively small hotel with 20 rooms over 5 floors. Clean and recently decorated, rooms are small (rooms with even numbers face the tiny pedestrianised street and are slightly larger) but perfectly adequate for a couple of night stay. As well as a bed, rooms include an ipod dock, coffee machine and they manage to squeeze in a bath but no wardrobe. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful throughout our 2 night stay. Location on the edge of a red-light district but at no point did we feel unsafe or threatened and the area has a number of quirky and (for Paris!) reasonable bars, cafes and restaurants. It's not a 5* or 4* hotel but it doesn't pretend to be! Value for money in an expensive city. We'd stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice and peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: tribru69
Reviews.Content: I and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel from 20 febr 2012 till 23rd. Before arriving in Paris, I had wrong and bad impression about Paris and Parisians from what i heard from people! But getting to the hotel reception was a nice experiance to begin with! A nice gentleman receptionist explained everything and check in was quick. Even though the neibourhood is not a fine area to be in , nobody bothered us, even in the night. In fact people seemed to be friendly than hostile. But the hotel is loacted in a peaceful side street. Rooms are small but modern, clean and good for the price. Bathroom also always sparkling clean, everyday we came back into the room. The Indian lady receptionist (especially) was so charming, friendly and helpful. The house keeping staff as well. Thanks to the whole team who made our stay comfortable! Will consider returning back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam R
Reviews.Content: It took us a while to find a hotel within our budget in Paris - at least, to find one that didn't have dire reviews. For the price, the hotel was amazing - any others of similar quality seemed to be a great deal more expensive. We stayed in a standard double room; it was fairly small (as expected) but not tiny, and was beautifully decorated and very clean. The bathroom was larger than we were expecting, and gorgeous (also very clean) with a huge deep bath and great shower. Toiletries included were: shower gel, soap, shampoo and bath salts (which we thought was a nice addition) there were also cotton pads for make up removal and a nail file. No conditioner was included but I'd brought my own anyway. We had breakfast on our last day there; at 12 Euro it was a little expensive, but there was a fairly good selection of pastries, yoghurt, bread, cold meats, cheeses etc, as well as eggs. Location - it's very close to the Strasbourg-Saint-Denis Metro station, less than 5 minutes walk, so very handy for getting about. It is located in a fairly run-down part of the city, but the street which the hotel is on is nice and quiet. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and if we were returning to Paris would definitely consider staying there again; it's very good value.

Reviews.Title: “reccomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: cincili
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint Martin we chose because of its good rating on TripAdvisor and we were not wrong ,the hotel is in an excellent position very close to the metro station in a quiet street closed to traffic, staff is very friendly rooms are very clean, the only problem is that there is no closet and fridge.Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Best Western traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel. The hotel was as presented on the website, recently renovated and nicely decorated. Being a regular visitor to Paris hotels, i didn't find the room to be to small, and it was well appointed. While the hotel is located in a busy area, the evenings are much quieter and well located to nearby restaurants and the metro. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: Very good quality and not too expensive. Friendly staff. Rooms are nice. (N°34) Not noisy in the night. bed is good. Wifi is not always working in the room bt it's working very well in the lobby. Nespresso machine in the room. Good area. We arrived early in the afternoon, so the room was not ready but we left our luggage and went for a walk. They also keep our luggage the whole day before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Holyday was good!”
Reviews.Author: IraRussia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has good location, 2-3 min to the metro station Strasbourg-Saint-Deni. There you can take 3 lines to get anywhere. It"l take you about 10 minutes to get to the Centre of Paris. The staff of the Hotel is very helpful, they provide you almost with all information you need during your trip. The breakfast is really good for Paria hotels, you can order fresh orange juice even. The rooms are clean. I was satisfacted with the choice of the hotel/

Reviews.Title: “For me the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michel99
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel for quite some time already and spend there at least one weekend per month. The hotel is located in a very safe area with some African shops and hairdressers and close to Les Halles and Le Marais.The hotel was recently renovated.The rooms are small but modern and clean with very comfortable beds. Free coffee (Nespresso machine), tea and water. The breakfast is very good. All people working there are great. For me a stay in this hotel is always a pleasure. Dear people from Faubourg Sait-Martin, thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ptkaos
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with comfortable rooms, very modern and trendy. The staff at the reception was always very friendly and although we were a little bit concerned about the surrounding area we did not have a single problem. The metro station is at a 5-minute walking distance. We've only stayed 1 night and the experienced was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Fennings
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a charming oasis on the edge of some slightly run down parts of Paris and the more tourist orientated areas. It is within easy walking disteance of Gare Du Nord and Gare De L'Est but is in a side street which could easily be missed. It has been recently refurbished and the public areas and room were clean, modern and appealing. The room was on the small side, but as I was only staying overnight, this didn't matter too much. It was next to the lift which did rattle when used. However, it was very clean, and comfortable. There is room service which was a surprise as I thought it was only a bed & breakfast hotel, but I only discovered this in the morning as it was not pointed out to me by the receptionist. To eat out, head South towards Boulevard St Martin where there are plentuy of bistros etc. Breakfast in the hotel was a very good buffet, served in the vaults under the building. Throughout my stay, the staff were very friendly and spoke English well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richard h
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend trip after getting off the eurostar, hotel is only a 10 min walk from the station. Hotel was very clean and appeared quite new, breakfast was lovely and filled us up for most of the day. The area is questionable with poeple just hanging around street corners all day, we would leave in the morning come back in the evening and there still there, the hotel is located between two main roads stick to the turksh side which has more poeple and cafes. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A true little Gem”
Reviews.Author: carolina h
Reviews.Content: Great value! Arrived to the hotel after a long flight and were greeted by very helpful and friendly staff. Found our room on the 4th floor very quiet (double glazed windows) and absolutely spotless with a comfortable bed and equipped with all the amenities required including Wifi, flat screen TV (well placed for viewing), a coffee machine, a safe and even a proper bathtub! Our room was perhaps on the small side but well designed. The buffet breakfast was great, with very generous choices of things to eat and drink. As far as the location is concerned - it's colourful, interesting and feels safe and is within walking distance to Centre Pompidou. Bus no: 38 stops on the major street around the corner and takes you right through to Quartier Latin within minutes. In short we were so impressed - we booked the same room for our next stop over in Paris in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Close your eyes to the location......”
Reviews.Author: Car0bella
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this small hotel. It is spotless, the staff are great, breakfasts lovely and our room, whilst not large, was light and had a window overlooking the internal courtyard. It is very well priced for what is on offer! The only negative really is it's location. Fairly close to Gare De L'Est, but in an are surrounded by what I initially thought were prostitutes, only to find they were simply people visiting all the hair dressing and nail salons-which are genuine!! Would we stay there again? Probably.

Reviews.Title: “Un petit trésor a Paris.”
Reviews.Author: alliec79
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad we found this hotel. It is a great deal for the price! We had a big enough room overlooking the tiny street on which it is located. The location is great and although some reviewers seemed to be concerned about safety, I felt completely safe, even walking back in the evenings. The hotel is located about a 5min walk to the nearest metro station. The room was lovely, in really good condition, and the staff ware friendly and helpful. The bedroom we had is perhaps not for the prudish. The shower is located behind the bed, separated by a small divider wall. There is no shower curtain so if you want complete privacy while you bathe this is not the room for you. That said, other rooms have different layouts and may offer more privacy. I plan on going back to Paris and would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god i found this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stickyfingers85
Reviews.Content: Firstly can i say that i spent weeks trying to find a hotel in Paris that was of good quality and a fair price. Paris is so expensive and i had almost given up hope of finding somewhere, eventually booking a cheap and very ugly looking hotel in the city. Thankfully, with a about 2 weeks to go until my trip i found this Best Western Hotel on the Trip Advisor and after reading the reviews and looking at the pictures i booked it straight away! Pros: Great location, close to 2 metro stops, with easy access to all the great sights Refurbished hotel so the entire place looks great. Lots of nice little touches like a nespresso machine and iPod/iphone dock in the room. Staff were great, helped us locate everything we wanted and even advised us the best way to get home after seeing Moulin Rouge Great room with cosy bed, although a little small but thats just Paris Cons: When you walk around the hotel we were a little scared as there are lots of guys hanging around on the street corners. We asked the hotel about this and they assured us that we were safe and that they are just touts looking for business for the hair salons. The breakfast is a little expensive, 12 euros each! If you look around the local area you can get a nice breakfast much cheaper Overall i really cannot recommend this hotel enough. The staff looked after very well, the rooms are great, the bathroom was great, and i can really say that i made our trip perfect :) Tip: Shop around for the best price for this hotel. I found a really cheap price on booking.com but after a couple of days i checked the actual Best Western website and if you were willing to pay in advance, and no refund option, i got another 30 euros off the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for beautiful but expensive Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JKAMO
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris once a year and find it tough getting accommodation that is not extortionate. I came across this hotel via a flash sale and saw it had previously had bad reviews before it's refurb. I have to say it is a great little hotel and needs to be put into the context of how tough it is getting decent accommodation in the city. Located in an area full of Afro hairdressers we were initially surprised and wary at the amount of men hanging around outside the hotel until we found out they were touts for the hairdressers. We ended up loving the location for it's proximity to the big sites - it's in walking distance of the lourve and for being near the trendy canel st Martin. A great spot for people watching. The hotel inside is fashionable and hip with nespresso machines iPod docks and funky interiors. I do think it may look a little worn in a few years. Even so the price is very good for Paris, the staff uber friendly and the area vibrant.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Faubourg Saint-Martin
HotelInfo.Address: 6 rue Gustave Goublier, 75010 Paris, France
